initial_assessment.question: Which of the following URLs is most likely a phishing attempt?
What is one sign of a potentially unsafe website?
What does the 'S' in HTTPS stand for?
What icon typically indicates a secure HTTPS connection?
What setting can help ensure secure browsing by default?
Why should browsers be updated regularly?
Which of the following passwords is considered weak and commonly used?
Why is using pet names as passwords risky?
What is the recommended minimum length for a secure password?
Which of these methods will strengthen your password?
choices: Using your name as a password
Using a memorable phrase with random characters
Using the same password for multiple accounts
initial_assessment.answer: Using a memorable phrase with random characters

initial_assessment.question: What is multi-factor authentication (MFA)?
choices: A method to verify your identity using a password only
A process that uses only biometrics for authentication
A method that adds an extra layer of security by requiring more than just a password
A method that automatically logs you in without needing authentication
initial_assessment.answer: A method that adds an extra layer of security by requiring more than just a password

initial_assessment.question: Which of the following is an example of multi-factor authentication?
choices: Logging in with just your password
Entering a password and receiving a one-time passcode on your phone
Using the same password across multiple sites
Using only a username and email address
initial_assessment.answer: Entering a password and receiving a one-time passcode on your phone

initial_assessment.question: Which type of malware disguises itself as legitimate software?
Which malware type can replicate and spread without a host program?
What does ransomware do to a victim's files?
Spyware often does which of the following?
How can malware typically enter a system?
choices: Through email attachments and unsafe links
initial_assessment.answer: Through email attachments and unsafe links

initial_assessment.question: Which hardware can spread malware like worms?
What is the main tactic used in phishing attacks?
choices: Using legitimate-looking messages to trick users
initial_assessment.answer: Using legitimate-looking messages to trick users

initial_assessment.question: Which of the following is an example of USB phishing?
choices: Sending an email with a suspicious link
Leaving malware-infected USB drives in public
Calling users pretending to be IT staff
initial_assessment.answer: Leaving malware-infected USB drives in public

initial_assessment.question: Phishing often appeals to which of the following emotions?
What tactic is used in baiting attacks?
choices: Offering free items or services to trick users
initial_assessment.answer: Offering free items or services to trick users

initial_assessment.question: What should you do if you receive an unexpected email asking for personal information?
choices: Ignore it or verify with the sender via other means
initial_assessment.answer: Ignore it or verify with the sender via other means

initial_assessment.question: What should you do if a message pressures you to act immediately?
choices: Click the link before it expires

initial_assessment.question: What is the first step when a cybersecurity incident is detected?
choices: Disconnect the affected device from the internet
initial_assessment.answer: Disconnect the affected device from the internet

initial_assessment.question: Which of the following is considered a good preparation step before a cyber incident?
choices: Use weak passwords to avoid forgetting them
Maintain regular data backups and practice good cybersecurity
initial_assessment.answer: Maintain regular data backups and practice good cybersecurity

initial_assessment.question: What is the purpose of isolating the affected system during an incident?
choices: To prevent further spread or unauthorized access
initial_assessment.answer: To prevent further spread or unauthorized access

initial_assessment.question: What should a user do after a cyber incident has been resolved?
choices: Identify what caused the incident and how to prevent it
Ignore the issue and move on
initial_assessment.answer: Identify what caused the incident and how to prevent it

initial_assessment.question: Why is changing passwords important after an incident?
choices: To prevent compromised credentials from being reused
initial_assessment.answer: To prevent compromised credentials from being reused

initial_assessment.question: Why should even regular users have a personal incident response plan?
choices: To act quickly and correctly during an incident
initial_assessment.answer: To act quickly and correctly during an incident
